Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Format package URLs in descriptions" (#7831) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Just a suggestion. 

Currently package links in descriptions look like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1697911/73567108-83d78700-441a-11ea-988a-ad0a8161e951.png)

What if we did something similar to what github does with issue links and formatted them with a shorter text:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1697911/73567252-d87b0200-441a-11ea-9959-f01f7fa09db3.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[C2R] Switch over to registration5" (#7830) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "RestoreNetCore_MultipleProjects_SameTool_DifferentVersionRanges_DoesNotNoOpAsync is flaky" (#9128) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "RestoreSources together with SDK dependencies seems not to work" (#9121) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I tried to move away from the NuGet.Config to a pure MSBuild based restore logic. When I try to set the RestoreSources in the Directory.Build.props and reference an SDK I get build errors:

```xml
   <RestoreSources>
      $(LocalSource);
      $(NugetSource);
      $(PrivateRemoteSource);
    </RestoreSources>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <Import Sdk="My.Sdk" Version="1.0.0" Project="Sdk.props"/>

```

The error messages are : 

> Unable to resolve My.Sdk for NetStandard, Version=0.0.
> C:\Program Files\.....\Sdk not found. Check that recent enough .NET Core SDK is installed. 

Actually I expect that sdk to be restored from the PrivateRemoteSource. It works, when I use a NuGet.Config instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Set NuGet 5.5 to RTM branding in preparation for GA release" (#9127) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "FireAndForget PM UI startup" (#9112) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The menu command builds the PM UI by calling JTF.Run blocking the UI thread. 

This is unnecessary. 
That can be made async. While that won't fix all issues with the PM UI startup performance, it will make it a bit better simply because now the UI thread is an async flow.

Related to [438211](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/438211/)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Docker dotnet restore file already exists" (#9126) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/2.2.207/NuGet.targets(119,5): error : The file '/app/.nupkg/system.numerics.vectors/4.4.0/system.numerics.vectors.nuspec' already exists.

NuGet product used: dotnet restore
NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): not sure how to check nuget version
dotnet.exe --version: 2.2.207
OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): win10 19551 pro
SDK Docker image: mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/sdk:2.2-alpine
Docker version: 2.2.0.0 (42247)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Mount app in docker image mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/sdk:2.2-alpine and run restore
```bash
dotnet restore ./MyApp --packages .nupkg --runtime linux-musl-x64
```

Running the dotnet from windows directly does not cause issues.
Tested with dotnet sdk image 3.1 as well, same results.

### Verbose Logs
https://filebin.net/p2csdej08vp8ln1b/logs.txt?t=suthfyn8

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Doc: "nuget config /?" has typo in config get exapmle" (#9122) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): NuGet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.4.0.6315

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Run `nuget config /?`:

  ```
  usage: NuGet config <-Set name=value | name>

  Gets or sets NuGet config values.

  options:

   -Set +                        One on more key-value pairs to be set in config.
   -AsPath                       Returns the config value as a path. This option is ignored when -Set is specified.
   -Help                    (?)  help
   -Verbosity                    Display this amount of details in the output: normal, quiet, detailed.
   -NonInteractive               Do not prompt for user input or confirmations.
   -ConfigFile                   The NuGet configuration file. If specified, only the settings from this file will be used. If not specified, the hierarchy of configuration files from the current directory will be used. To learn more abou
                                 t NuGet configuration go to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/configuring-nuget-behavior.
   -ForceEnglishOutput           Forces the application to run using an invariant, English-based culture.

  examples:

  nuget config -Set HTTP_PROXY=http://127.0.0.1 -Set HTTP_PROXY.USER=domain\user
  nuget.config HTTP_PROXY

  For more information, visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference
  ```

2. See that the `nuget config HTTP_PROXY` command has an extra dot.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add a TypeConverter for the SemanticVersion class" (#9125) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Error on downgrade version due to transitive central dependency. " (#9124) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When a transitive dependency cause a version downgrade an error needs to happen. This item tracks the work needed to find a solution for this problem. 
Linked with [[Centrally managing NuGet packages and versions] Implement the restore graph changes](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8910)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Contentfile in nuget gets compiled causing build errors" (#9123) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a nuget that has a contentfile in it. ContentFile is a json file and denoted as such in the nuspec file when the nuget is packed.

When installing the nuget in a regular wpf app, I get a couple build errors. It appears that Visual Studio is trying to compile the .json file. Wondering if anyone knows what may cause this. As you'll see in the nuspec snippet I have BuildAction=None in the nuspec

ContentFile.json(1,1,1,2): error CS1022: Type or namespace definition, or end-of-file expected
ContentFile.json(4,16,4,26): error CS1001: Identifier expected
ContentFile.json(4,37,4,45): error CS1001: Identifier expected

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19433674/73555610-f1d07e00-441b-11ea-81be-05b14b2ab0f2.png)


Note: Visual Studio 19. The nuget was packed from command line using nuget.exe in a batch script. The batch script runs "nuget.exe update --self" before packing the nuget
